Holmes's eyes narrowed, and he leaned forward in his chair. "What kind of trouble, Mr. Rucastle?" he asked, his voice low and urgent. I saw her arguing with a man in the garden, a man I have never seen before. They were speaking in low tones, but I could tell that they were angry. I fear that my daughter is in grave danger, Mr. Holmes, and I implore you to help me." Holmes's face was set in a grim mask, and I could see the determination in his eyes. He was on the case now, and he would not rest until he had uncovered the truth. "Do not worry, Mr. Rucastle," he said. "I will do everything in my power to help your daughter. "This is my daughter, Violet," Rucastle said, his voice full of pride. "Violet, this is Mr. Holmes, the detective. He is here to help us."
